number of helpful: 117 of 127 people (92%) found this review helpful8 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: September 4, 2015
-Quick Review-Alien Swarm is a Top-Down shooter with emphasis on multiplier teamwork with four total players. Alien Swarm was developed by Valve and released mid 2010. Many of the initial players were lured to the game by the lure of an Alien hat you can unlock via an achievement on Alien Swarm.-Detailed breakdown review-Story: You are a member of a team of space troopers who are investigating the circumstances of a seemingly abandoned/evacuated space colony, and trying to recover whatever data is still available.


Uploaded for the review. 
A Screenshot of Alien Swarm
By: Atratzu




Gameplay: Alien Swarm is played from a top-down shooter angle from a 60 degree camera angle, you move your cursor to aim, and can simultaneously walk any direction using the keyboard keys.Some people have dedicated servers for Alien swarm, however most people will simply host a game from their computer, your latency will depend on the hosts internet settings and physical location.As you succeed or fail missions you will gain experience, this experience is put towards your level, when you level you unlock new weapons, armor, and tools. There are 25 potential weapons that can be chosen from, including special weapons like sentry guns.


Combat sample. 
A Screenshot of Alien Swarm
By: Atratzu




Achievements: There are 66 achievements on Alien Swarm, after your first level you will get a good grasp of the different achievement difficulties, at the time that I'm writing this review, I've earned 53 achievements, most of which were earned either grinding by myself (by using a console command, it's possible to play solo online), or joining small groups online or playing with a friend occasionally.There are two types of tough achievements: Beat the game on the hardest difficulties, and speed run achievements, both of these require a fairly coordinated group of players to work together and know what they're doing.Price: The best part about Alien Swarm is that it's completely free! This is probably because the project was scrapped after the first campaign. It's nice that this game is free, but I would have preferred to pay for the game if it had a single player mode and more campaigns.The good news is Alien Swarm was released with an “Alien Swarm software development kit” which is also free, so the Steam Community could create their own campaigns! Second best thing to the original dev's picking up the project again.


One of the hacking mini-game Samples. 
A Screenshot of Alien Swarm
By: Atratzu




Conclusion: Story: forgettable, but this game is more about the experience then the story narrative. Gameplay: addicting, fun, best to play with friends. Achievements: Many are soloable, you're better off with a group of pug players the easiest difficulty is your best bet if you want to learn the game. Not an easy 100% completed game. Price: Completely free to play.I love this game, even if it's free to play.  I've enjoyed playing this game in between playing other games more vigorously.  I recommend this game to anyone who wants a change of pace from the "status quo" of games out there. "This game will specifically appeal to gamers who enjoy dungeon crawlers, third person shooters, and alien kill grinding.------Edits and updates------Edit/Update May 30, 2015:spelling, grammar, and punctuation fixes, thanks Angfucious! :)

number of helpful: 58 of 61 people (95%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 30, 2016
 Overview  Alien Swarm is a game with a unique and interesting backstory to how it came to be. Sporting a top-down camera with an adjusted 60 degree view and set in a sci-fi realm, Alien Swarm arms you and up to three additional friends for some seriously fast-paced shooting and survival combat.For those unaware of the history of Alien Swarm, it was created from a mod from Unreal Tournament 2004 by a team that was hired and supported by Valve. Originally, the game was produced by Valve, but unlike some of the more popular titles such as Counter-Strike, Team Fortress or the Half-Life series, it never really got the focus and recognition that the others did. In fact, there is only one official campaign in the entire game, called “Jacob’s Rest”, which is comprised by only a handful of levels. However, that does not necessarily detract from the overall appeal of the game. An obvious downside to playing Alien Swam, as mentioned, is the one solo campaign. Within the confines of this one mission, your task is to land on a colonized planet, investigate what happened, exterminate all hostile alien lifeforms and rescue any survivors. You’re given a choice between four classes: “Officer” – your primary gunner who earns passive damage and resistance bonuses as well as unique weaponry unique to only them, the “Medic” who heals teammates, the “Tech” who can deploy sentries, hack systems, weld doors with incredible speed and can carry class-specific grenades and auto rifles, and lastly, the “Special Weapons” which boasts massive damage output. Within these classes are 40 different equipment pieces that you can select based on your class, play style and need, making customization fairly simple and streamlined.The game, as mentioned above, as a major drawback: that one campaign. However, the game included the software development kit [SDK], which, for those not familiar with the term, is the source code to it, allowing for full-scale modding and customization. This spawned a vibrant modding community that has made some truly fantastic campaigns to play, keeping Alien Swarm alive and well with new content and challenges. With the SDK included, users can play any of the user-created content, create their own or modify ones to their liking or specifications.With all that said and as with other Valve products, Alien Swarm has a smooth multiplayer interface, full overlay support and integrated invitation options to invite your friends. While playing solo is fun in its own right, the game really shines when playing with a group of four, invoking the need for communication, teamwork and support of everyone involved; make no mistake, Alien Swarm can be extremely punishing.A variety of difficulties, friendly fire penalties, tight corridors and waves of aliens means Alien Swarm will test both your reflexes, intuition and ability to work together as a team. Don’t get cocky, because when you die the game will freeze and slow motion capture your painful, premature death and let you know who killed you. So if you’re use to blaming your “friendly” fire on glitches, your friend or the enemies, the game will most certainly be there to call out your transgressions for all to see.With consistent statistical data being tracked outside the game [much like other Valve titles], Alien Swarm provides an in-depth look at what classes you excel at, what weapons you prefer, your accuracy and how many times you sabotaged the mission with excessive friendly fire and much more. It becomes a handy tool when deciding who you want to complete some of the more excruciatingly difficult achievements the game has to offer. Alien Swarm is one of those games I feel should really be re-examined because what is here, is wonderful. Smooth level design, crisp features, class customization, full source code and level design and a great atmosphere make it a great game to play for newcomers and veterans alike. There’s a severe amount of untapped potential within Alien Swarm. Did I mention, it is free? Pros   It’s free so there’s no risk involved. Try it! Solid multiplayer and co-op supportResponsive firing mechanics Class variances make each class important in their own way SDK support for complete editing and modding support. Make your own campaigns! Cons    The original campaign is the only one that was introduced with the game, making the starting content lacking and the downloading of mods necessary to fully enjoy this title and increase its replayability. Overall, Alien Swarm is often overlooked by other Valve titles. While the consensus among fans is that it is a worthy title to sit down and play, many people might not be familiar with it or know how it came to be. As more and more titles are being released every day, Alien Swarm still stands as something worth playing, even after all these years. Seriously, get out, recruit some friends and go blast some aliens. You won’t regret it.

A great fun and free 4 player co-op top down shooterPros:+Free +4 player Co-op+Varying levels of difficulty+Levels and gameplay are entertaining+Great atmosphere for fans of alien games+Good amount and variation of weapons and equipment+8 playable characters, each with their own pros and cons+4 different roles/classes that encourage tactical team playCons:-Story itself is not good-Not a lot of people play the game-A lot of players only play for a TF2 hat-Harder difficulties can be insanely tough-Achievements to get but are not easy, hard to 100%-Very short game, 7 levels or so and they are not that longDownload Size: 2045mbAchievement Difficulty: Very hard to 100%Hours to 100%: 50+Rating: 8/10Recommendation: Highly recommended, even better since its freeMy Opinion:Despite the low player count on this game I highly recommend getting the game and playing it, I'd advise bringing friends if you can but you can still find others playing. The game is short but offers a good amount of entertainment and alien killing action. And being free you have nothing to lose.

number of helpful: 25 of 25 people (100%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: February 13
												If you are looking for an action shooter with team cooperation where mindless running will get you killed this is a game for You. On most dificulties the games enemies coming in waves enforce cooperation. Fireing lanes start to matter and even when you are not on point but securing the back You feel like Your job matters. The game offers 8 marines to pick from. A pair of each of 4 archetypes. The medic, whos main role is to heal any damage and cure infestations. The Autogunner whos there to push the group forward or to set up supressing fire defending the group. The demolitions marine is best suited to dealing with heavier targets with the use of flamethrowers, mines grenades fire traps and the mean end of a shotgun. Finaly theres the technician for those who want to make the missions easier by welding doors and hacking security and objectives. Individual skill is rewarded with all of these archetypes without the loss of sense of benefiting from the teamwork of entire group. The setting pays hommage to classic movies and games of the alien franchise yet remains its own kind of alien style with a bit more arcade look. The topdown camera gives a more tactical feel for the gameplay in comparission to first person. Each marine has his own quips and oneliners, and character. Since its free i cannot see how you wouldnt recommend it.

content:
Posted: May 9, 2016
Product received for free
												Interesting top-down shooter that is free to play for all Steam users, uses the Source Engine 2010.  Based on the movie Aliens.Alien Swarm is a top-down shooter set at a 60-degree angle. Four players can join a single co-operative game, the aim of which is to progress through science fiction-themed levels while eliminating waves of AI aliens. Players can choose from 40 different pieces of equipment. The game is class-based, with players choosing from the roles of Officer, Special Weapons, Medic, and Tech. Each class has two selectable characters, with differences in abilities. Officer = Grants a passive bonus to damage and damage resistance to nearby allies. He has access to the Vindicator, a class-restricted shotgun with an incendiary grenade launcher and has general all-around abilities. They are also capable of throwing extra amounts of explosive ordnance, and may find class-restricted ammo caches on the field for his Vindicator shotgun. The two playable characters are Sarge and Jaeger.Special Weapons =Brings raw damage to the table and starts out with a customized autogun with superior parameters, high magazine capacity, and auto-aiming ability. The Special Weapons gains access to a powerful minigun at a high enough level, and can pick up class-restricted ammo caches on the field. The two playable characters are Wildcat and Wolfe.Medic= Is the only class able to equip and deploy temporary healing beacons, and at a high enough level can use a medigun to selectively heal teammates and themselves. The two playable characters are Faith and Bastille.Tech =Carries a motion sensor, sets up sentry guns faster, welds doors faster, and is the only class capable of unlocking certain door panels or completing certain objectives by means of a hacking minigame. They also have access to a prototype assault rifle with auto-aiming capabilities and the ability to fire stun grenades. The two playable characters are Crash and Vegas. The game includes persistent statistics, unlockable equipment, and Steam Achievements.for more info:


YouTube™ Video: Alien Swarm Review

number of helpful: 15 of 15 people (100%) found this review helpful3 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: December 23, 2016
												In a gist, it's a fun top down action game that eschews stats and loots for a more tactical and visceral experience. The core of the game is planning your route through the campaign and mowing down hordes and hordes of aliens as you and your friends are barely hanging on to life. Sweet.Some things in Alien Swarm that I would love to see in other games of this genre:- Shared map where you can all plan your route. - Minimal loot, minimal stats, focus is on loadouts and interesting effects (freezing, burning, electricity etc.). Going through loot is tedious when all you are doing is increasing DPS.- That climatic end. Believe me, if you don't spoil yourself by playing on a lower difficulty, the finale is worth the wait.- The tactical nature of the game. The game gives you a lot of tools and weapons. Bar the door, and the alien has to spend time smashing through it. Lay a wall of fire and watch the hordes melt before your eyes. But all the defenses are temporary, and the aliens can and will overpower/overrun them. You and your friends have to plan properly to use your limited resources for victory. Some of my favorite moments in this game is defending a point while hordes and hordes of aliens stream in from everywhere. All the defenses and traps we laid are exhausted but we do manage to pull through.On top of that, with friendly fire on, you really have to plan things out so you don't end up shooting each other. You even lose ammo if you reload early! That's a feature that's missing on a lot of games. There are some cool things in this game borrowed from third person shooters, like crouching (for cover) and calculating line of sight so you don't hit obstacles/the floor/the wall. Definitely makes the game feel more "grounded" and adds to the tactical layer, although I honestly don't remember if I ever used crouch.Get some friends, play on brutal (yes, from the beginning), and have fun.

number of helpful: 16 of 19 people (84%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: August 24, 2014
												Alien Swarm is a game forgotten by both Valve as it's developer and the community. A game that had potential, but comes out just feeling unfinished. The concept is good enough, but it probably got canceled and someone just decided that it would be shame to leave it, and put up what they had at that time. And well, if it wasn't good enough, people didn't like it enough for it to become good thanks to the community.The only thing that truly keeps this game alive, if you can even call it alive, is the fact it's fully Free to Play. No payment on Steam, no microtransactions, nothing. You can join the fray at any time and see what they got in store for you. However, it still features a level system - the more and the better you play, the bigger level you are and the better equipment you get.This unlocks one of the games biggest advantages - a very smart equipment system. You can choose between four classes, with two characters for each, both with completely different playstyles. Then you get to choose your equipment, two weapons and a utility. Of course, all four of the classes have access to equipment available only to them, as well as access to certain shared equipment. For example, the Medic is the only one capable of carrying the Medikit or the Medigun, the Commander is the only one capable of carrying shotgun, the Engineer is the only one capable of carrying a rifle with autoaim etc. The game then features more than 40 weapons and about 15 utilities (if i recall correctly). This allows you to play the game differently every time, but thanks to the level system, certain weapons will always be better than others, even though the game does try to balance them out.The gameplay is then based around a co-op mode for four players. You (and hopefully a team you can trust) are sent to a colony gone dark to investigate, and *drum roll* fight off aliens there *badumm tshhhhh*. However, you are alone. So you need to conserve ammunition, use medkits and cooperate while holding off the bugs in order to survive, and fulfil objectives along the way. All in a top-down Source game. That means the SDK makes the maps quite interesting, counting in things like fire, liquids or destructible enviroment, even some in-game animation parts along the way. This all creates a feeling of being swarmed and overrun, yet deeply dedicated to ending the mission succesfully and without casualities. Talking about casualities, it's worth noting that there's friendly fire ON by default. Watch it.Probably the most notable change is the Source SDK here. If a big community would be on... millions of maps. IT's just that easy to make them. Tile based creation and Source modelling = Map. I tried it out myself, it took me exactly 76 minutes to recreate the first level. It's just sad it is not used.Also please note that Win 8 is not supported by this game. It will run after you install it, but Win 8 will screw up it's files and you'll have to reinstall sooner or later.As to my recommendation, I can say that this is a game you will enjoy at first, and then become disappointed by later. Play at your own risk.

content:
Posted: December 16, 2016
Clear out all Infestation Marines!


Wtf are the Bugs on the left doing?.. 
A Screenshot of Alien Swarm
By: Jaeger




The amount of self-created memes and laughs you can get out of playing a game to death is great, but then theres the fact that you played the game to death. Its a game that classifies itself under boring in long sessions but can never be left completely because the short focused fun with friends is worth it 90% of the time, I think i can definitely say that after 700 hours (And..slowly counting.). Its a borderline arcade game which certainly explains why the campaign is so short (7 x 10 minute long missions.) but at the same time has some great full on action game moments. Its very dated and has bad graphics by today's standards but makes up for it with a Top down action experience that valve did well to make (for the SHORT time that they did). Since its free i hardly need to sell the best bits of the game but you read this far lol. 


With our powers combined.... 
A Screenshot of Alien Swarm
By: Jaeger




aaanyway this is a great game, its a very different game to what valve normally does with first person, AWPs and Expensive Hats .It is extremely team based for two reasons, 1-Bots are just terrible (the worst bot in my opinion is called faith which is extremely ironic...) 2-You need friends to cover your♥♥♥♥♥at all times on the harder difficulties. The fact that its a team focused game has got me to play it quite a bit, hardly any time solo in fact. Its an interesting mix of taking care of the team, keeping an eye of many things at once and knowing when to stop shooting and heal up.. You might even meet some new friends..i mean  marinesAnyway i can condense many paragraphs into simple pros and cons so here they are:


Too Late the Hero 
A Screenshot of Alien Swarm
By: Jaeger




PROS:+Action scenes are epic as hell and the final fights in the campaign missions are very climatic.+The finale of the campaign is so well done, overall its length is average but the final part of the story is shown so well amidst all the damn swarm!+Levelling and prestiging system is fair and provides good weapons for bad players and vice versa. Its very balanced, which is funny because the humans are fighting aliens! not each other..+Some weapons feel like they are built for levels and other feel like they are built for medic, heavy, etc. which is obviously great in such a class focussed game.+Characters have unique personalities, yet dont do much else than shoot and talk, although this isnt really important for the type of game that AS is.+many Custom maps are avaliable! although since its a dated game it isnt as easy to get access to as L4D2 for example. thats one of the main problems with this game, its dated but more importantly, not supported for valve anymore, no updates new maps , etc.+The Ending is great and sums up the little story that this game has. Little to no sequel material (Obviously!) generated here.+The shared map feature where you can draw on a map to show your team mates the best routes!+the Hardest mode is actually really hard! and may take weeks to master levels by yourself or with 2 players.+Speaking of hard difficulties, playing action music works really well when battling through a level with friends, it really fills in the gaps where the games epic soundtrack should behttp://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=846178288CONS:-The Simple fact that its an old game is enough for 6 cons at least.Just be ready for glitches, bugs, aliens, crashes, bad optimisation, frame drops, and obviously all of this happens in the worst moment (Murphy's law?)-some of the best weapons that are great in getting achievements and speedrunnig are aaaall the way at the end of the unlockable weapon armory. this is just to get people to play longer but its still annoying for newcomers with experienced friends!Speaking of newcomers.. This game is literally only klept alive by TF2, how is that you say? Well there is an item for tf2 that can be exclusively gained in this game by playing 2 co-op missions online (Too easy!). I personally find it sad that this game is kept alive by tf2 and dedicated players obviously but its clear to see that the popularity is waning. This isnt the fault of the game however. Its still amusing to see what people will do in tf2 to get a new item ;)-Default key binds i found to be very uncomfortable. This is easy to change however.-Every time you fail a mission it doesn't give you an option to immediately restart it and instead, takes you back to the weapon select menu. Which is damn annoying because the load times are normally irritatingly long.-The story is decent...But far too short!!!-Valve has indirectly killed this game by not adding workshop in its prime...Its quite easy to see how this game could have gone down a different path if you didnt have to go through the hassle of downloading the mod packs off a site rather than just downloading it straight from the steam workshop.I seems L4D2 proves this point well! Since its still a strong game due to the modding community..-They should have added a bit more story or at least a new mode such as survival, play as the alien or target Practise. Which is funny because L4D2 has all of those modes!! (Replacing aliens with zombies obvously.)-No Starship troopers references-No nods to alien. The parasite doesnt count!-First person view is extremely difficult to find and activate! If there isnt an instant bind for it then why bother?http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=642721022Dont be fooled by the size of the cons list vs the pros, it just the explaining created the illusion.I'd Rate this game an 8/10! Great for a free game!And thats my review for this free game! It currently has an overwhelmingly positive rep on its page, lets hope it stays that way. :)Im so excited for AS: Reactive drop!!Now if youll excuse me a Glitched bot is getting attacked on the other side of the map..-Kyle

content:
Posted: June 2, 2016
												First game I ever played on Steam, years ago now.  Helped me come to accept that Steam wasn't malware :P.Some people say that the community is dead, or bad.It's not, there's still a large number of pro players active.  Many welcome new players.  Some times when you try to find a game, at that moment, there may be none available.  Still plenty of people playing; each lobby holds 4 players, each game takes a few minutes.  Every full lobby is invisible.  People come and go.  Consider starting a lobby yourself if at that moment you cannot find any players, it's rare for more than a couple minutes to pass without someone joining.  If nobody ever joins your hosting, check your ports, maybe you're not set to handle hosting - that would keep people out of your game for sure.Or just check for open games in 30 seconds or so.  There's often quite a flux of players going.Years after I started to play this game, I keep coming back to it.  I like how the teamwork works, I like how the game is complex enough at the higher levels that I'm still getting better at it, even after so many hours of play.

content:
Posted: December 3, 2015
												Custom map packs can be found Here:http://steamcommunity.com/app/630/discussions/0/864945140574517670if you have problems or questions installing, i have a guide for that.The game is good. really good. it just has no content.from what ive heard, Valve made this game as a test for some new employees (Black cat games? I don't know). The way i see it, it turned into an expiriment to see if a community could keep its own game alive. it was the sort of 'power to the people' thing that the unreal tournement mods had (hell, alien swarm WAS an Unreal Tournement mod.)The game was basically made to have custom maps made by its community. Its Open Source with a very large number of spare unused assets not found in the only offical campaign.They had a website to upload this content. That site was Swarm armory.Not long after, the plug was pulled and Swarm armory never came back up. Without a sort of 'Offical Hub', noone wanted to hunt down the download links to the maps people were playing, and people gave up on looking for them.  The things people worked hard on were altogether forgotten or were only found by an incredibly small number of people, and that made a good number of the map/mod developers just give up and move on to somthing else.     The only newcomers to this game are blokes looking for the parasite hat for TF2. they basically never stick around either, due to lack of content and any form of offical modding support.Bearing this in mind, I belive the game was meant to be run entirely by its community. (though I would REALLY love to see Steam Workshop Support...) There ARE people who play the game often enough, and as far as I know there ARE people who are still developing maps (slowly). You just gotta look for them. Hard.Only complaint: why the ♥♥♥♥ is a flashlight a high tier item, and why is nightvision not nightvison?

content:
Posted: July 21, 2016
												Alien Swarm is a top-down shooter. The game has a campaign that can be played in co-op with up to four players. There are four classes available: Officer, Special Weapons, Medic and Tech. Each class has two characters with different stats for one or more of the following: aim, ammo, reload speed,  special abilities speed and others.It's a great short game, also it's free! It takes about 1-2h to finish, there are quite a few difficulty modes and other settings that add a lot of replay value to the game, such as friendly fire dealing more or less damage, and onslaught mode, which brings a high variety of enemies to the beginning of the game to make things more interesting.Unfortunately not many people play it these days, but I still enjoy it from time to time.

												The game presents one of the best isometric coops I have ever seen. (And take in consideration that I'm writing this in July 2016). It's well thought of, dynamic, stable, and challenging. You have to actually coordinate with the team, pre select the gear, get good with the class you use, etc."Watch where you are shooting, shitbag" is the most common phrase you gonna hear in the voice chat. Because when♥♥♥♥♥♥hits the fan, everybody panics and shoots and pray. And you can shoot with a good variety of guns, and inventories are not over colmplicated.Cons: mmhhh, the game starts right up, in a slow pace, but some mechanics are not explained at all, and in the middle of the chaos you can get confused at first with what the hell your self healing pack does, or your welder... but that's old school and cool at the same time. Not really a con. If I may, there's only one real con:TOO SHORT, and no steamworkshop... what the hell? I could play this for years with no problem, dammit steam!

content:
Posted: August 5, 2016
												 Available free of charge, the game thrusts players into an epic bug hunt featuring a unique blend of co-op play and squad-level tactics. With your friends, form a squad of four distinct IAF Marine classes. Plan your attack using an unlockable arsenal of weapons with countless loadout configurations against a wide variety of aliens. Blaze your way through an overrun, off-world colony, eradicating the alien infestation in environments ranging from the icy planet's surface, to a subterranean lava-flooded mining facility. Along with the game get the complete code base for Alien Swarm that features updates to the Source engine as well as the SDK. Alien Swarm adds 3rd person camera, depth of field, improved dynamic shadows and a wide variety of gameplay additions to the Source engine.

Posted: February 4, 2014
												Having over 150 hours on record, this is easily one of the most addicting (at least, at the time) free to play games I've ever laid my hands on. Once an Unreal Tournament 2004 mod, is now a polished standalone game, kind of a sequel of sorts, on Steam.It's a third person top-down shooter in which you and three friends blast your way through levels infested with hostile aliens and complete various objectives as you work your way through areas. There's quite a bit of weaponry to choose from as well as items, most of which you can unlock by completing levels and gaining exp and thus leveling up eventually.I kind of wish Valve would make a sequel to this with like 4 or 5 campaigns so we could buy it, play it, and love it.

content:
Posted: October 14, 2015
												Alien Swarm is a free top-down cooperative shooter where you will have to pass a small campaign of 7 levels of shooting down cute aliens who look like cousins to headcrabs from Half-Life franchise. It's a remake of Unreal Tournament 2004 mod with same name, I sure remember playing that one once.The thing is, this game is strictly multiplayer. You can't beat it in single-player. Well, I mean, you can surely force yourself to, but it's not designed for this, hard and doesn't reveal full potential. Game has practice mode with bots, but only through the first two levels. Otherwise, you better find three more marines like you. Thankfully, public multiplayer is active enough, can find at least one game running.And yea, it's focused on teamwork by using loadouts. Got to balance between general and specialization and then not to shoot each other during gameplay. While campaign is short, it grows in difficulty non-stop, so there will be a challenge to a good team. Can always increase difficulty.It's just a shame that it doesn't fit to lesser player count. I mean, would be nice to have it like in Left 4 Dead, where all spots are always filled with bots and players just take their place, and thus can always expect a support. Because when you play it with just one friend, it's hard to balance between firepower and special stuff. Almost always one tech, almost always one medic or you will die. But hey, not designed for that after all. It sure can be tough with just friend even on easy, sometimes.Oh, there is no microtransaction. Valve didn't bother to profit from this in anyway, it's just that some devs that Valve hired were original creators of Alien Swarm mod for Unreal, I heard. It got modding support, but no Steam Workshop. And uses leveling system with which you can unlock new items as a way to prolong the life.But eh. For free, it's pretty nice team game. But could use better music. Like most games.

content:
Posted: September 26, 2016
												Atmospheric:The aliens in the vents make their noises,and the motion scanner bleeps kep you on the edge of your seat,and make you fall off when you wander into an ambush.Hard:This game requires tactical eye and teamwork between you and your squadmates.You must play smart and look after each other, because that is one less gun in the game, and your chances of survival become very slim at best.Fair:If you get eaten it means 'you dun goofed up'.Tie game doesn't resort to cheating.The alien AI is quite smart and they caneasily outsmart you if you aren't paying attention.Fun?:Alone:It can be fun, if you are skilled enough and are used to RTS games. But it can be frustratingly hard solo.With 1-3 friends:Two-player game is quite fun, but this game shines with a full squad of human players as you struggleon towards your objective, counting on each other,and hoping you can pull it off without any hirches, and that everyone survives. Of course, this is where friendly fire comes into play.'Friendly fire is not'. You WILL take damage from squadmates.In the beginning you are more likely to die froma squadmate trying to shoot an alien trough youthan the actual alien. In this game players need good communication and discipline to make it troughwhile still being ready to take action at any time.This doesn't mean this game is meant for twitch players.I'd say it is quite the opposite. You can survive by playing the game as a twitch action shooter,but you can negate need for reflexes with some tactical awareness and being in the right place at the right timeand anticipating the enemy.The only negative things I can say about this game isthat there aren't many enemy types and themain campaign included is a little short. I really do wish they added more official maps to this game. Overall?This game is hard. But incredibly rewarding. And free. Definitely worth adding to your Steam library and giving it a spin.So what are you still waiting for?Click that "Play Game" button already!LOCK AND LOAD!P.S. Did I mention you also get a free hat for Team Fortress 2?

content:
Posted: November 16, 2014
												Alien Swarm.This game is a birds-eye co-op game that is qquite fun but has some issues.1) Community - This game can be very fun, but nobody plays it. Working in teams of four is the only way to beat missions on tougher difficulties but the only way to have a team of four is to play with friends or on singleplayer (which sucls)2) Class restrictions - While you can play as any class in the game 2 are required for most missions. The Tech, who unlocks doors and completes objectives is required for some missions and if they die, you lose. The Medic - THis is the main problem, because there is no good way to heal other than the medi-gun some player is froced to go medic. Not too bad sometimes but if no-one else your playing with has unlocked the medi-gun, it can be hell.3) ITS TOO SHORT - A huge problem with this game is that it only has one campaign with 8 or so missions. These can be really fun but once completed there's not much to go back to.Now that I'm finished with negatives, here are some of the postives1) Classes - You can play as four classes, which are usaully fun with a good loadout. The Leader has a nice all-around skill, The Heavy just shoots the crap outta the aliens, the medic will save you from parasites and death and the tech unlocks doors, completes adjectives and is very useful. Oh and did I mention there are two characters of each class, for more variety :D2) Parasites - Yes, I just said parasites are a positive thing for this game. Parasites are small aliens that latch onto your head and maul you unless you can be healed. While these can induced frustrating and quick deaths, they are a challenge that forces you to stay together with your medic.3) Aliens - Of course they had to be in here! While not in to much variety, the types that there are make the game interesting (and sometimes a pain in the♥♥♥♥♥).4) The weapons - You unlock weapons as you level up. Sentries can provide a quick escape from a quick death and the flamethrower is incredibly fun to use!5) Levelling up - Levelling up gives you a sense of achievement as you shoot the crap out of aliens with that amazing new minigun you just unlocked6) And finally loudout customization! - The game features 3 slots to change weapons, a primary weapon to kill things with. A secondary or piece of equipment. This can be more ammo, another weapon, a sentry etc. And finally the 3rd slot (forgot the name) which can carry passive armour, light attachments, welders (very useful) and other helpful things.7)It's free too! (almost forgot.In summary it's a fun game but it has a small community which can ruin it. But all-in-all you might as well try it out because its freee!

Posted: December 10, 2014
												There is a lot of fun to be had here once you get the hang of things and start to understand the few maps the game has.  You do need the right team-mates however when playing online because team-play only enhances and prolongs the fun while  running off by yourself will only make things harder.There is enough variation in the gameplay with different classes who each have their own strengths, abilities and (unlockable) weapons. As well as the levels that you go through that all have their own objectives that you need to accomplish before you can move on. It keeps things fresh and interesting for a little while, though that replay value could have been longer if the campaign wasn't as short as it is. Luckily there is always the modding community you can trust on to provide you with tons of new maps you only need to do a bit of work for it because there is no Workshop support as of yet.Best thing of all though.... it's completely free!

content:
Posted: August 12, 2015
												I like this game very much. Because I am playing it with my friends almost every day. I have gotten the last achievement in 236h of gaming. But enough of me. I am going to do some pros and cons for the gamePROS-The game is very well done, the graphics for my PC are stunning-The game is based for CO-OP or should I say Multiplayer, because if you play Offline Practice (Singleplayer) the bots are stupid and are sometimes pain in the ..... so it is useless to play singleplayer-Another pro is that the Valve has given us the Alien Swarm - SDK tool, so the community can make it's own maps and campaigns instead of Valve-We can make our own servers with Alien Swarm Dedicated Server tool, which I see every day there are only 27 servers, which 6 of them are constantly full-This game is simple to play because it is born with "Rock n' roll" style-If you get bored playing only Jacob's Rest campaign, you can download custom campaigns on moddb.comCONS-Valve has forgotten about this game-Community is slowly dying10/10 for me, would Rock n' roll againI strongly recommend this game to everyone who wants to have fun without Pay To Win system. This game is FREE!It only matters your personal experience!Have fun playing this game!

number of helpful: 5 of 5 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 13, 2014
												Alien Swarm is easily my favorite top-down shooter game to date and it's 100% free, created entirely by a team of 4 modders hired by Valve, Alien Swarm shows that top-down shooters can be so much more than monotonous room-clearing wave fests populated entirely by tie in movie games.A co-op centric game, Alien Swarm does one of my favorite video game elements I never thought to see in a top-down shooter, team based gameplay, including several classes, all of which have their purposes, Officers support and rally the squad, Special Weapons use hard hitting rapid fire weaponry, Techs hack and weld doors shut, cutting off Alien ambush points and Medics Heal and keep the team in good health. Every class also gets thier own set of unique weapons, the Officers Vindicator shotgun is a personal favorite.Level design is excellent, but this shouldn't be surprising comming from Valve, the layout accomodates for both players and enemy AI alike, sporting choke points for players to cover one another from and ambush points for the aliens to really get the heat up, it's for this reason you'll commonly find yourselves forming a diamond-esque formation, so that a number of your squad is pushing the team forward whilst the others are stopping any potential attacks from behind as you attempt to complete your current mission objectives.You wouldn't think it, but Alien Swarm is also very rich in atmosphere and story, littered throughout levels are several datapads, leading up to-and explaining what had become of the colony of Jacob's Rest - The location which the game takes place - and sound design helps to add the overall presence the game gives, the sounds of claws rattling throughout the vents of the colony, the punch guns give, giving satisfaciton with each shot fired and each enemy slain.All in all, I feel like a criminal playing this game completely for free, the quality is far better than alot of other top-down shooters out there charging an insulting £10 price, if you have a group of friends or just want to go on a well constructed bug hunt with some randoms, I see no reason why you shouldn't give this a shot. A very friendly and active community, several weapons to unlock and try out, tertiary abillities to use, from grenades, temporary slow motion to missle barrages, Alien Swarm is a good time to be had by all.

content:
Posted: June 24, 2014
												I loved this game~ It's light, it's cool, and it's sci-fi. And it's -not- FPS (though I hear you can make it go into first person view). Unfortunately at the time I played there weren't any other people to play with, but that doesn't make it any less fun. Even the default offline mode was fun. I do wish it had more maps and levels for offline/single player as well and/or online solo maps for beginners.Edit: Wrote a new, more proper review below:I feel like this is a really underrated game. It’s a shame people almost no longer play this game, because I just really enjoyed it. It's light, it's cool, and it's sci-fi. And it's -not- FPS (though I hear you can make it go into first person view). Unfortunately, during the time I had it installed and played there weren't any other people to play with, but that doesn't make it any less fun, as you can go into single player mode. Even the default offline/single player mode was fun… for a while. The game is a pretty typical top-down shooter with a leveling system to acquire better upgrades and weapons. It’s actually quite nice, if not overly original (group of marines hunting down bug-like aliens). The graphics and sounds aren’t anything to write home about, but they’re not bad either.I do wish it had more maps and levels for offline/single player as well and/or online solo maps for beginners, though, because as far as length it’s quite short, and after playing it over and over on your own it gets rather boring. I know you can manually install different maps, but it just becomes a hassle, as the game doesn’t have workshop integrated. This is really a game best enjoyed playing with friends, and that’s how I recommend you play it if you’re interested.  And the best part of all? It’s free! ;)

content:
Posted: August 1, 2014
												In case you all ask: I didn't try this game out just for the hat. I just wanted to try something new.And, well... this game gave much more than I expected it to give.It's a great four-person co-op game. You and three other players take on the roles of a Marine squad dropped into a colony overtaken by an alien infestation. This takes you on a campaign consisting of seven missions, watching your squad in top-down view kick♥♥♥♥♥The controls are the simplest, but that doesn't mean the worst: you move with WASD, aim with your mouse. It's bare minimum, but that's very intuitive and aiming is made a lot easier by this.There are four character classes: Officers, which use powerful Vindicator shotguns with huge stopping power and also increase the abilities of their squadmates, Special Weapons who use heavy autoguns to mow down enemies, Medics who tend to the team's health and Techs who are able to use tools better than others and perform hacks. The game offers two characters in every class, each one with different abilities (for example, between the two Medics, Faith is faster and a better Medic overall, but Bastille is tougher, better at combat, and gets a bonus to using adrenaline shots). This not only allows you to choose a character of the required class that will suit your playstyle, but also puts a hard limit on the number of duplicate classes a team can have (since there are two characters of each class, that means - go figure - up to two of the same class). Something a LOT of modern class-based games would use.In terms of weapons, you get only a handful at the very beginning, and unlock more as you gain experience and level up. However, standard weapons are usually the most useful and reliable, with only a few really neccesary unlocks (such as a medigun. Yes, a frikkin' medigun. Which works just like any TF2 player would imagine it to work). This makes resetting your levels for cosmetic "promotions" not that painful, on the other hand.The game gives you a variety of enemies to fight: other than the standard Drones, Rangers and Mortarbugs which attack at a distance, Boomers which are basically walking suicide bombers, Shieldbugs which require flanking and teamwork to hit their weakpoints, and Parasites which can infest and kill a marine very quickly, unless the Medic takes care of the victim.The official campaign, while very short, has a high replayability, and the game also offers the fan creators development tools to create their own works.Unfortunately, despite its high quality, the game isn't too popular. You might find maybe 20-25 dedicated servers and 5-10 lobbies at any given moment. Speaking of the lobby option, it doesn't show you the ping of that particular one. You're forced to connect and then use the "ping" console command to check it. It's kind of a waste, but that's a technical problem that could be easily fixed, and doesn't really matter in the long run.Overall, this is a very, very good game. I highly recommend it to any survival horror fans, as well as shooter players and co-op gamers. It would be a sin to not at least give it a try.

content:
Posted: June 16, 2016
 MY REVIEW ON A GREAT GAME To tell the truth, I loved this game  A LOT , because it brings back memories to when I first joined steam. It was my first.... no second game on steam, my first being portal 2  FYI, Portal 2 is awesome :D , and I played a ton of co-op, like, literally, a  TON . Sadly enough, besides nostalgia, and a free TF2 hat, this game has no reason for you to be playing it.You may not know, but this game is actually, truly free, and the community lets you know about that. I particularly like this one review of the game:Originally posted by ShMo:I got it for free.Downloaded it for free.Played it for free.Leveled up for free.Got all the gear for free.Reset my level to get a Prestige badge for free.Died for free.Got good for free.Speedran a few levels for free.Beat a level on the highest difficulty for free.Recommended the game for free. 	Anyhoo Did I really just say anyhoo? , This game has the Left 4 Dead 2 style of co-op where you do the singleplayer missions for co-op, and that's cool. But, some of the objectives are  UNBEARABLE  without more people, and even then they are still a pain. I don't have much to say, so thats it.This was my review of Alien Swarm, and I hope this taught you a bit.

content:
Posted: November 6, 2016
												This is one of the 1st Co-op games I've ever played on steam, and continues to be one of my favourites. It has action, thriller and teamwork all bundled up in one campaign that you must complete with 3 other players. I had good memories playing Alien Swarm with friends and others a like. Despite the repeitition of the game (there is only one campaign in the game), the outcome may differ based on your team composition, experience and other criteria. I also heard from a friend that this game was basically a F2P version of Helldivers too, lol.Unfortunately Valve no longer has updates for the game, and because of that there are many old glitches, bugs and other technical issues that hasen't been resolved by the developers. For me, the loading screen tends to stretch longer than that of my team members sometimes even leading to crashing the game.Luckily, a lot of these issues are resolved by members within the Alien Swarm community, which I would add, is fairly small now but still a nice place to relax and communicate with other members. It's an old game, but still fun to play imo. I recommend playing it with friends, as there aren't many public matches nowadays.

number of helpful: 5 of 6 people (83%) found this review helpful3 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: September 22, 2015
												Alien Swarm is a team based birds eye view space themed shooter that in my opinion is quite underrated. Firstly, it is by Valve so you know it is good, except in the case of Ricochet but anyway. There is a large arsenal of weapons, tools, sentrys and other cool stuff to choose from and unlock from beating parts of the main Campaign with friends. I wouldnt say its something that brings new things to the table but it is still a quite fun game. But now the downsides, firstly, the game is barely played by anyone and there are pretty much never any servers open and the only way to level up is to play with friends or on servers, and for people like me who have no friends, it is quite annoying. secondly, Valve never bothered to make a second campaign for the game and it literally takes about 30 minutes to play through the whole game, so it gets quite repetitive if you are trying to level up and get new wepons, tools, etc. because you are playing the same 30 minutes of gameplay over and over. and finally, I am quite dissapointed that there is no way to unlock a rope so I can hang myself which we all know is a vital aspect of any game. So that lack of a rope really lets this title down. But I would still say the gameplay is fun and it was a good idea to begin with, even if it wasn't free I believe a game like this would be worth your money if you enjoy games of this genre. I just wish Valve expanded on the campaign more, and added a rope feature.

content:
Posted: January 3, 2014
												Alien Swarm, Ahhhhh were do I start.  This awesome FREE 3rd person shooter is all about getting to the exit and killing, hacking, burning and slashing your way through the levels. Of course there is more to it than that, you can choose 8 classes.  I think that includes Tech, Medic, Heavy (not sure name), and a support character (not sure name).  You have a leveling system which lets you keep unlocking the good stuff. This is an amazing game for no cost at all.  PROS-Free-Lots of hours of enjoyment-4 difficulty levels-Multiplayer-Fun campaign-Dedicated server installer-Modded serversCONS-No bosses-Laggy at times-Easy if you have grenade launcher or flamerthrowerThis is an awesome game and I recommend everyone getting it

content:
Posted: April 13, 2014
												As much as I hate third-person overhead games, this was surprisingly designed well to get used to. Gameplay is a combination of TF2 and L4D with a little wiggle room on the weapon types. L4D since it requires four players, and TF2 with four classes. My pet peeve with this game is that it only has one campaign, and since it is like so many years old without any updates, the online community is nearly dead. Pick up a friend to play this game and have a good time for a bit. This game has so much potential, and I hope to see a big update soon or Steam Workshop Integration.

content:
Posted: June 12, 2014
												It was a couple of summers ago. A friend and I had nothing to do, and we got bored of the usual few games that we engage ourselves with: Left 4 Dead, Team Fortress 2 and so on. We ran out of things to play with empty wallets as well. We were students, merry, but poor, and then we saw this new free-to-play game on steam known as Alien Swarm. No harm giving it a try, right? Little did we know that we will be spending the whole of our summer rolling around a blue-themed spaceship setting aliens ablaze. Alien Swarm is not a big project or game in particular, or so to speak. There is only one campaign of 7 maps to choose from, and the game itself gets repetitive in the long run. Still, what makes this game fun and captivative is the co-operative nature of this game and the array of weapons the game offers. Choosing the right class and weapon will be highly beneficial for the game play as having the right setups will shorten or lengthen the gameplay by up to 10 minutes, and there will be a drastic difference in reward as well. Since this game uses a leveling system, it will mean that one of the best case scenario is to look for a map where you can do quick runs (in a minute or two) over and over again so as to accumulate the largest amount of experience in the shortest time possible. One thing I am found of for free-to-play games developed and published by valve, especially Alien Swarm in particular, is that there are no micro-marketing. Meaning, every single item in game are attainable through a little bit of hard work and grinding. It’s free, and if you have the time to spare, what’s your reason for not trying?

content:
Posted: June 11, 2014
												This game is incredible considering that it is free!-It has a large plethera of guns each of which has a specific purpose,-There are multiple characters (8) to play as, and they are not only divided into classes, but are also give separate attribute boosts to things such as healing, damage, hacking, etc.-Combining the characters and guns in different ways helps benifit your team and the gameplay in a lot of different ways, and opens up a lot of unexpected cumstomization.-The enemies are INCREDIBLY varied, and how the levels and difficulties work make the gameplay aything from CoD-level gameplay to Dark Souls level mayhem.-The community is good, i have yet to meet a single douchbag or 10 year-old playing this.-And even if you suck at picking up games, or haven't ever palyed any top-down-rpg/shooter stuff like this, the way the levels progress make sure you get much better by the 2nd level. (This also adds into the benefit of the community as there are VERY few players that will need to be carried through any levels)

content:
Posted: January 4, 2013
												10/10Alien Swarm is a fantastic sci-fi top down co-op adventure. Gather your fellow space marines and embark on a journey of heroics and alien obliteration. The campaign is too short, and the user made maps I've tried were not too interesting, but there are five difficulties (brutal is definitely brutal, and you'll need to make good use of a full squad), and speedrunning will keep you busy for many hours! I think it has to be the best free to play on Steam.

content:
Posted: September 24, 2014
												Alien Swarm is an interesting game. Interesting in the way it plays, and the ideas behind it. When it first came out, it was expected to be a simple base for people to mod with. Not an uncommon feature for a game, since there are games just for modding like Gary's Mod. Yet, Alien Swarm didn't change that much once released. The community didn't mod it, and those that did never made much head way.But thats beside the point. The game is great for some fun times. The co-op campaign is fun, and having someone there to cover your back is nice. Aliens come from everywhere. From the vents, holes, cliffs, even a few test tubes on certain levels. You can spot some entry points easily, but always be ready to turn around and fire after a few seconds. Aliens also tend to swarm you from behind if you move too slow. The game is meant to be a run and gun through the hordes of aliens, often running back once you reach a dead end. It also offers a nice variety of aliens, from the standard minion to the hulking tanks. Each mission is unique, and always challenging when played again.The only downside is that finding a group to play with is a bit hard. While the game is free, very few people stick with it. For many it will be a simple beat the campaign, and move on game.So grab it, play it, and have some fun.

content:
Posted: April 5, 2014
												This game is one of the few good free games on steam and I feel it doesn't get the attention it deserves so yes I recemmend this game game to anyone who's a fan of sci-fi games and the gameplay is better than I thought it would be for a top-down shooter. I discovered this game when I was an f2p n00b in tf2, I got killed for the thirtieth by some guy wearing the Alien Swarm Parasite and it was awesome looking to me, and I would stop at nothing to get this hat, I looked up the hat name online and found it was a promo item for this game. I did some more research and found that the game was free, and in my mind I was like: "Awesome hat. Free game. Must download.".  And so that's that, I found this freaking awesome game, played the **** out of it, and now it sits in my steam library begging me to play it, and I do every once in a while. The biggest let-down was when I first played the game, I thought it would be some awesome popular MMO that would be the best game ever, and when I finally did play it. It was like some run-down depressing bar that I just walked into. The thing that ****** me off about this game, specifically Valve, is that they just said it was an expirement to see if a game like Left 4 Dead would work, and the free-to-play section of the steam store. I would pay Valve to continue support of this game such as updates and the steam workshop.

												Attention please !Alien Swarm, awesome game? Yup, but if you are to stupid to understand friendly fire simply happens, don't play and let the others have some fun.Anyway, the game never gets old.One main campaign with maps you'll remember well but.. the game changes on every level of difficulty.You'll choose different weaps for different maps and - yea - different level of difficulty.Have a taste of the slaughter.Feel the power of the flamethrower on easy/normal and the weakness on hard+.Easy ♥♥♥♥ you say? Let's click onslaught mode and test you all the way with random spawns.Still not enough? Hardcore friendly fire option should be enough to satisfy you.Especially when some noob shoots you in the back:pBtw. some additional campaigns are in the internet ! You internet have? You download them have to.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 21, 2012
												This game is amazing, I highly suggest you play it, there are many weapons to unlock, you can play with up to three of your friends, and the characters all have thier own ups and downs. The only bad things about the game are that it can be hard to find an online game due to the lack of players, and there is only one campaign that is quite short, that is not too big a problem due to being able to download campaigns off the internets, along with being able to change the difficulty in a couple ways. You can just up the difficulty, or you could make friendly fire really punishing, or turn on onslaught mode. So while the campaign may be short, you can make it challenging enough for you, or get more online. This game also has a lot of achivements, all of them fair to get with a good difficulty curve. Plus if you win two levels you get a hat in Tf2 for free, so yay.

content:
Posted: January 4, 2013
												10/10Alien Swarm is a fantastic sci-fi top down co-op adventure. Gather your fellow space marines and embark on a journey of heroics and alien obliteration. The campaign is too short, and the user made maps I've tried were not too interesting, but there are five difficulties (brutal is definitely brutal, and you'll need to make good use of a full squad), and speedrunning will keep you busy for many hours! I think it has to be the best free to play on Steam.

content:
Posted: January 3, 2015
												I see no cons on this game, except the fact it has no off line campaign. The dynamic is great, you can easily move across the map, the controls are simple and easy. You have a large variety of things to unlock and the guns are well balanced. Add the fact that you MUST team up to survive. You can't go alone like a Rambo-like-soldier and expect to survive. Each one has a role. For instance: you can't proceed without a tech soldier; and you need another one to "seal the doors"; a medic plus a guy who can assemble a sentry gun.It's fun it's free and it's made for us. :D

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 27, 2014
												Great game that is totally free! The fighting gets very intense, you will need to plan ahead and try different tactics, and the cooperation involved will leave you and your friends shouting "Need backup!", "Get out of my line of fire!" and finally "Help-help-help-help-help!" til the very end of the mission. You can download quite a lot of additional content, so you'll be able to have fun spending as much time playing the game as you can, and definitely wish you could spend more.

content:
Posted: August 6, 2016
												The game is good. This one thinks it could be scaled back, as it is near impossible to finish alone, and with others it is just as bad. Communication with other Klans is key in this game, but everybody seems to kill♥♥♥♥♥. This one has observed two types of players. There are supports and there are tanks. Neither work alone making the game very difficult, as tanking is never truly valid. One can die from a single parasite, the size of a rock, head humping you to death and you cannot shake it off. And playing as a support this one has realized is impossible alone, as you will run out of ammo very fast and one cannot carry both Med and Ammo crates. This One's final qualm, is that progression is slow. One must Grind alot if they wish to reach the end alone on anything higher than normal. This one writes it as 9/10 viewing it as an arcade game, and 6/10 as a full game. It is very short and leaves you wanting more.-1 from Arcade for Replay Value, Near Perfect for what it is. This One thinks it is at the very least sequel worthy.-4 from Full for Replay Value, Difficulty Scaling, Community, and Fairness as an SP game. One absolutely CANNOT beat this alone. Easy is possible though the jump to normal is huge. Brutal is only possible with a capable, tactical and intelligent squad. It took This One and One Other around 40 minutes to pass the first level on Brutal with half of our deaths being due to FF, so watch your sh*t because we're d*mn good shots and im not just stroking my gooch here.This one's advice: Take your time, and play it right. Never Pre-load (You lose your clip, Ammo is your life force, your Chi. It would be like using an Eve Syringe before you ran out of Adam in level of value) and Kill Everything that moves before proceeding and fall back to a choke point when it's too much. Never Rush though a level without a Timer. And Watch your fire. Friendly Fire is Brutal in this game and Death is permanent until the level ends or the squad dies. If playing solo, Rock the Ammo Crate & Tech AR for lightning grenades. This game is built to be Iron Manned. One must simply learn to Iron Man it. Float like a Butterfly, and Sting like a Bee. Sure you can play as a class with higher D, Perhaps even use a Ballistic Vest. But in the end, if One is taking damage, One is not dishing out damage, and One will have a hard time killing. If One is not taking damage, One may dish out damage, and One may kill with ease. The key, is to dodge, duck, dip, dive and dodge your way to f*ckthatville because in the end, if you aren't killing them, they're killing you. Focus not on killing the enemy, but on preserving your own life, and that of the team's when online. They eventually stop spawning allowing you to "Train" The enemy as One would in a typical zombie game. However, One is only able to train in large areas, as many Aliens come at once. This One thinks the game's title serves it well in that aspect.

Otherwise, this is a very addictive, fun, replayable, cooperative top-down shooter that never gets old! 9/10 easy. :-)

Posted: January 11, 2015
												UhNot too sure what to write here so heres a recipe for Pancakes insteadIngredients:1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour3 tablespoons sugar1 tablespoon baking powder1/4 teaspoon salt1/8 teaspoon freshly ground nutmeg2 large eggs, at room temperature1 1/4 cups milk, at room temperature1/2 teaspoon pure vanilla extract3 tablespoons unsalted butter, plus more as neededNow to make it1. In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, baking powder, salt, and nutmeg.2. In another bowl, beat the eggs and then whisk in the milk and vanilla.3. Melt the butter in a large cast iron skillet or griddle over medium heat.4. Whisk the butter into the milk mixture. Add the wet ingredients to the flour mixture, and whisk until a thick batter is just formed5. Keeping the skillet at medium heat, ladle about 1/4 cup of the batter onto the skillet, to make a pancake. Make 1 or 2 more pancakes, taking care to keep them evenly spaced apart. Cook, until bubbles break the surface of the pancakes, and the undersides are golden brown, about 2 minutes. Flip with a spatula and cook about 1 minute more on the second side. Serve immediately or transfer to a platter and cover loosely with foil to keep warm. Repeat with the remaining batter, adding more butter to the skillet as needed.6. Procedure for adding fruit to pancakes: Once the bubbles break the surface of the pancakes, scatter the surface with sliced or diced fruit, or chocolate chips, nuts, etc. Flip with a spatula and cook for 1 minute more, being careful not to burn toppings.

content:
Posted: May 26, 2014
												Alien Swarm is still my favorite multiplayer co-op game and is also the reason I created my Steam account.  In its current state, you will have to find friends to play this game with as the community is basically empty. However, back in the day, before TF2 went free to play, there were only 4ish free games on Steam and Alien Swarm was one of them. Alien Swarm could often be seen as the second most played game right after Football Manager 2011 it was da bomb and for good reasons besides being free. After Team Fortress 2 became free to play, and Valve's new Free to Play category soon after Alien Swarm slowly saw a decline in players until it had finally reached the barren state it currently is in. So if you plan on playing this, get some friends or hope that you will find a game during steam primetime.Alien Swarm can be very punishing if you make a mistake. It requires its players to stay focused, move quickly, and keep together as a team. This makes the game very difficult to new players trying to figure out how to be successful, and I've seen players never figure out how to work together and drop the game.However, when playing with other good players and finding out what you do best in the team Alien Swarm can become an extremely fun game that ends up being one of the best co-op games that I happen to know about.

content:
Posted: October 24, 2015
												Alien Swarm is a unique game especially for that of the magnificent Source engine, as it is viewed through a top down perspective. This kind of game play style isn't experimented with or even used that much in most games, so making an entire game with this formula is quite the achievement on it's own right. The game play revolves around classes that have specific roles on the battlefield. These classes include officer, an all around class with added bonuses for the team. The special weapons, a class that uses a variety of unique and powerful weaponry to blast through the enemy. The medic, a class that is there to look out for the team with their healing capabilities. And the technical specialist, who acts as an engineer of sorts who can build structures and deal with other machinery on the map. There is also a varied amount of weapons and gear to unlock and have fun with for each class. Teamwork is a very important aspect of this game, without it you probably wont get to far before the alien bugs come for your blood. The aliens themselves have good diversity as well, with different battle styles that you will have to adapt to quickly to survive the alien threat. This is a blast with friends and if you and a friend or two are wanting a good co-op experience this is definitely a great choice.

content:
Posted: May 13, 2012
												It is fun to play with friends , but the servers are dead . The graphics are very nice , for a 2010 game . Valve do know how to make coop games , but this one was just a commercialized product rather than something real , and I will tell you why : -- Remember those times back in 2004 when Valve launched the Source engine for the first time ? That was the time when Half Life 2 came out , and along with that , Counter Strike Source and Day of Defeat . The engine wasn't shining because it was just stealing from the PC's resources . So Valve anounced that they will improve the engine . That is how the Source SDK Base public tool was launched . It was , and still is a tool that allows the community to use the Source engine in creating mods , games , or even used to run Source-based games . To prove that it can be used , Valve launched the "Swarm" project , a closed and very secret project that will prove to the players that the Source engine can be fixed . So , after 3 years development and updating the SDK , Alien Swarm came out . Unfortunately , it did not last long , as it could be compared to a free and a more strategic Left 4 Dead 2 . --That is my theory . I think the game is great , and the fact that its free makes it even better . Overall , for the gameplay and graphics , but with poor level design and AI , i give this game an 8.5/10

content:
Posted: June 22, 2014
												This game is kind of a double edged sword. I can't even imagine playing it alone or with mostly strangers. The game has nothing new to offer and the gameplay is pretty much all the same throughout the game, unless - unless you play it with your friends who are the same kinds of space, alien, sci-fi, comic books, fantasy and so on freaks as you are. Then you're gonna have a goooood time playing the game as a four-member squad in narrow corridors, snowy space stations swarmed with, well, alien swarms, you're gonna split the duties on opening the doors, downloading data, guarding the ones doing so, rescuing your friends overwhelmed and left behind, panic when those frakking little pieces of whatever you wanna call it jump on your back and poison you or your friends and you're trying to save them, watch your friend flawlessly handling a shotgun in desperate last stand of your soon-to-be gone epic squad. I wasn't expecting anything and anytime we play this we have a great time. Partly because we kind of roleplay the game when we play it, but Alien Swarm is really a enjoyable game when it comes to the multiplayer experience where you expect fun only

Posted: February 11, 2011
												Allen's Warm is the touching story of a paraplegic man that finally gets the feeling back in his legs on Christmas.  When Allen's wheelchair is pushed too close to the fireplace and his legs catch on fire, a sudden memory of his fireman days gives him the strength to finally stop pretending he can't walk (if only every other "cripple" could do the same *sigh*).  "Warm up" to this cheerful holiday classic.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 13, 2012
												It is fun to play with friends , but the servers are dead . The graphics are very nice , for a 2010 game . Valve do know how to make coop games , but this one was just a commercialized product rather than something real , and I will tell you why : -- Remember those times back in 2004 when Valve launched the Source engine for the first time ? That was the time when Half Life 2 came out , and along with that , Counter Strike Source and Day of Defeat . The engine wasn't shining because it was just stealing from the PC's resources . So Valve anounced that they will improve the engine . That is how the Source SDK Base public tool was launched . It was , and still is a tool that allows the community to use the Source engine in creating mods , games , or even used to run Source-based games . To prove that it can be used , Valve launched the "Swarm" project , a closed and very secret project that will prove to the players that the Source engine can be fixed . So , after 3 years development and updating the SDK , Alien Swarm came out . Unfortunately , it did not last long , as it could be compared to a free and a more strategic Left 4 Dead 2 . --That is my theory . I think the game is great , and the fact that its free makes it even better . Overall , for the gameplay and graphics , but with poor level design and AI , i give this game an 8.5/10

content:
Posted: June 22, 2014
												This game is kind of a double edged sword. I can't even imagine playing it alone or with mostly strangers. The game has nothing new to offer and the gameplay is pretty much all the same throughout the game, unless - unless you play it with your friends who are the same kinds of space, alien, sci-fi, comic books, fantasy and so on freaks as you are. Then you're gonna have a goooood time playing the game as a four-member squad in narrow corridors, snowy space stations swarmed with, well, alien swarms, you're gonna split the duties on opening the doors, downloading data, guarding the ones doing so, rescuing your friends overwhelmed and left behind, panic when those frakking little pieces of whatever you wanna call it jump on your back and poison you or your friends and you're trying to save them, watch your friend flawlessly handling a shotgun in desperate last stand of your soon-to-be gone epic squad. I wasn't expecting anything and anytime we play this we have a great time. Partly because we kind of roleplay the game when we play it, but Alien Swarm is really a enjoyable game when it comes to the multiplayer experience where you expect fun only

"Warm up" to this cheerful holiday classic.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 26, 2013
												This is a top down shooter to start off.Graphics: The graphics are an odd one because for a game like this, top down they are actually pretty decent and are very well presented, which weirdly makes the game decent just on that note, but we know graphics do not make a game!Audio: The audio is again fairly odd for this one, but some how it all works as one which is awesome from the odd gun sounds, so the weird mic hissing noise sounding like a radio but at the same time it does not. Controls: The controls are super super easy to use and get used too.  It's pick up and master and you got this. Game: The game has a decent amount of ranks you can get through, always levelling after max (12) and fennel resetting and getting a special tag, go 12 more and reset and getting a better badge, kinda like Titanfalls system or cods system of ranking up. Sadly the campaign is very very short and you will often want to download other creations to play to play through, but even they are short too. So this game is short at best. There are some great difficulties to choose from and if you want to push then insane/ hoard... You will run out of ammo before the first door and why this is made is beyond me. The game is coop which is awesome, seriously awesome, you'll see alone in this game is boring. Also the game is free to play so how can you pass this up....Would I recommend? Yes why not it's an easy few hours of fun

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 20
												Pretty good game that requires teamwork and encourages comms. Friendly fire will eat your team alive if everyone's firing blindly, whereas having each person dedicated to defending an angle keeps you alive. Run and gun gets you killed, moving up with your team slowly gets everyone through the level alive. Full-auto eats through all your ammo, burst fire gives you just more than enough.A bit short, but every level is worth it. Only negative was its length.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 23, 2014
												Really nice game! First off, I think it's one of the most overlooked games (most likely because it's free so people instantly assume it's mediocre quality). The downside to this game is that you only get half of the experience if you play alone. Playing with friends is way more interesting because each player can focus on his own role, allowing the others to specialize in something else, compared to playing alone where you have to be your own medic and your own engineer... so on. It's quite a difficult game when you pay it the first time because it's going to be tricky to figure out what you have to do (which is not bad) but it might be slightly frustrating especially if you play with friends, you die and you have to start form the beginning. There is a fair amount of variety when it comes to alien enemies and the game keeps throwing new things at you constantly, also graphic wise it looks quite good for a top down shooter, especially when a team member dies and the camera zooms on him and dramatically showcases his death in slow motion.That being said, once you get the hang of it, you will feel amazing cooperating with the other players and playing quite strategically.This game gets a thumbs up form me.. and I should play it again.

												This hidden game was secretly affecting my steam achievements completion rate and i didn't even realize it! I re-installed this game and gave it a real try and found it fairly fun. Though I'm not huge into the space genre, I was able to play with some cool people to help me reach the 100% achievement. This game is basically a team of space marines fighting monsters doing missions. Each marine can have a different load out and specialty, which you get more weapons while leveling up. If you like a top down humans vs zombies game, this is definitely for you. For myself, glad it's completed. :p
