												An extremely fun top down 4-player co-op shooter where: (read more to see numbered list)You♥♥♥♥♥♥off other randoms by being a noobYou finished a mission without seeing much aliens on your way, wondering what on Earth is going on. Also, other(s) has/have been waiting for you at the end for centuriesYou finally were able to stick with the rush team, but you still have no idea on how were they able to rush like maze runnersYou praised a level 27 with 6 promotions who soloed ¾ of the mission when all the other teammates are deceased. Also, you realized he/she had some cool tricks up his/her sleeve when spectatingYou finally unlocked the almighty grenade launcher. You blasted yourself into giblets 3 seconds later. You made a life-time decision, 'Flameflower, I choose you!'You realized that you were left with newb weapons after you lost your promotion virginityYou learned to use (some) newb weapons competently as you had no other choice(SpongeBob voice) One year later...You get praised by playing average, soloing ¾ of the mission when all the other teammates are deceasedBonus: it is completely free.But hell, we have HELLDIVERS™ now. And no one seems to see it as the spiritual successor of Alien Swarm (or know that Alien Swarm exists). I will definitely buy it when it is on sale (if i have the mood to play by then)

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 26, 2013
												This is a top down shooter to start off.Graphics: The graphics are an odd one because for a game like this, top down they are actually pretty decent and are very well presented, which weirdly makes the game decent just on that note, but we know graphics do not make a game!Audio: The audio is again fairly odd for this one, but some how it all works as one which is awesome from the odd gun sounds, so the weird mic hissing noise sounding like a radio but at the same time it does not. Controls: The controls are super super easy to use and get used too.  It's pick up and master and you got this. Game: The game has a decent amount of ranks you can get through, always levelling after max (12) and fennel resetting and getting a special tag, go 12 more and reset and getting a better badge, kinda like Titanfalls system or cods system of ranking up. Sadly the campaign is very very short and you will often want to download other creations to play to play through, but even they are short too. So this game is short at best. There are some great difficulties to choose from and if you want to push then insane/ hoard... You will run out of ammo before the first door and why this is made is beyond me. The game is coop which is awesome, seriously awesome, you'll see alone in this game is boring. Also the game is free to play so how can you pass this up....Would I recommend? Yes why not it's an easy few hours of fun

content:
Posted: April 24, 2016
												This game is free, so I guess you can't beat that price. There are still some shortcomings, but again...it's free. The campaign it comes with is pretty short and can be beat in a few hours, but it's still pretty fun to play through, and each level is really well done. You can download other custom maps too, or create your own with the SDK it comes with.Gameplay wise, it's pretty simple but I think it's effective. Movement is tight, and there is a good variance in enemies and weapons. Some of the achievements were a pain but still fun to get. I'd give it a 6.5/10. I think it's a really decent game, but it could have been so much more if Valve put in the effort to make it available for OS X and Linux, and pushed Workshop for it.

content:
Posted: August 26, 2014
												Alien Swarm is a tactical squad-based survival game with a decent progression system. The roles in it are: Leader, Medic, Tech, and Special Weapons. The loadouts are limited. The options can feel endless. Some areas are dark. Some areas are harmful. Some aliens are harmful. Some aliens are REALLY ♥♥♥♥ING HARMFUL. There are also certain elements in it that require Medics and Techs. When someone dies, they stay dead until after everyone alive gets to extraction or everyone dies. It can be very easy to die. Simply being serperated in a ♥♥♥♥♥♥ spot can lead to being surrounded in a corner while reloading and a very quick and painful death. Some say being eaten alive is a rare delicacy in some cultures. Others say that that is ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t and being eaten alive is ♥♥♥♥ing terrifying. Anyways, Alien Swarm is free to play.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 23, 2014
												Really nice game! First off, I think it's one of the most overlooked games (most likely because it's free so people instantly assume it's mediocre quality). The downside to this game is that you only get half of the experience if you play alone. Playing with friends is way more interesting because each player can focus on his own role, allowing the others to specialize in something else, compared to playing alone where you have to be your own medic and your own engineer... so on. It's quite a difficult game when you pay it the first time because it's going to be tricky to figure out what you have to do (which is not bad) but it might be slightly frustrating especially if you play with friends, you die and you have to start form the beginning. There is a fair amount of variety when it comes to alien enemies and the game keeps throwing new things at you constantly, also graphic wise it looks quite good for a top down shooter, especially when a team member dies and the camera zooms on him and dramatically showcases his death in slow motion.That being said, once you get the hang of it, you will feel amazing cooperating with the other players and playing quite strategically.This game gets a thumbs up form me.. and I should play it again.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 22, 2012
												Le jeu est gratuit et plonge les joueurs dans une chasse aux aliens en coopération où il faudra agir avec stratégie.Formez un groupe de choc et utilisez de nombreuses armes.Un petit régal pour les fans de SF des premiers temps...Les graphismes du jeu sont vraiment beaux, les textures et les effets sont convaincants.Une bande son de bonne qualité, des bruitages et les voix des marines dans le ton.Jouabilité intuitive et nerveuse assez facile à prendre en main pour n'importe quel débutant.Le mode coopération n'invente rien de nouveau, mais il est très bien réalisé.Ajoutez à cela une marge de progression bien réelle et l'apport stratégique de la co-op avec ses quatre classes bien balancées (médecin, ingénieur, gros bras et as en explosifs), vous obtenez un must-have.Un jeu qui, dans ses mécaniques, n'est pas sans rappeler un doux mélange de Left 4 Dead, Alien Breed et Diablo.Cette virée spatiale est faite pour vous gratuitement et en CO-OP.18/20

content:
Posted: November 15, 2016
												Hello Fellow Marines,Alien Swarm is an interesting game at that. The teamwork concept seems like a wonderful idea! I love how the team has their specific roles, it's a very strategy driven game which makes it all the more fun! Unfortunately, if you aren't playing the game with friends only, it can be extremely chaotic. I've had several teams where people just kill me or refuse to chase the objective. I have a mixed feeling about the community, but the game itself is a wonderful concept. For free, I'd recommend getting this game with a few friends, you'll enjoy it! Without friends, it gets fairly annoying entering public lobbies. Overall, I recommend Alien Swarm!-Kyle James

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 13, 2014
												Everyone who has ever played starcraft will understand what I mean when I say "Zerg rush." That's what you're fighting through: A constant, sudden stream of aliens intent on killing the woefully outnumbered (and squishy) Space Marines. Several classes to play with from the start, and an impressive armory to unlock as you level up, means you can play however you see fit. At the impressive cost of nil, and with the exuberant community putting out new material, I have no issues reccommending this game to everyone who'll listen.The only down-side to this game is the random players thrown in. A surprising number of them tend towards the aggressive side of things, and there's a lot of Last-Man-On-Earth posturing. Open-mic is useful, though. Allows everyone to communicate as they need to in order to complete the objectives of each stage. By all means: go for it!

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 3, 2013
												Alien Swarm is the quintessential Free-to-Play Steam Game and is one of the few 4-Player Co-Op games that can offer both the difficulty of the old-school while successfully maintaining the look of a newer-gen game. The difficulty scales depending on how many are in your party, and in my opinion, so does the amount of fun! Really the only thing I feel might be missing is expansions or custom stories. Despite the lack of expansions or custom stories, the ability to change diffuclty offers a replayability factor that will be more than a challenge for you and your friends. Bottom Line:This game will provide many hours of entertainment and should be played in a group for the full effect. If you have not played this game, download it now! Kanoobee's Rating:8/10-

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 6, 2014
												One of the best top down first person shooters out there. This game is intended to be played as coop for up to 4 players, each player can pick different classes and choose equipment in every mission, resulting in a huge variety of tactics and splitting of domains. As you complete missions you gain more experience and level up to get more equipment and skills (the better you play, the faster you level up). Both weapons and items offer a huge diversity and a load of fun.The atmosphere is brilliant and leaves no room for wishes and the game offers more content than most games do nowadays (I would be still playing if there would be more content.).

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 20, 2014
												Easily the best 4 player Co-op shooters I've ever played (and one of the few out there really).It features great map designs, enemies, weapons and makes you rely on teamwork like never before.On top of that, it's free.I've had a blast playing this game with 3 other friends and I wish there were more games like this.However the main campaign, despite being awesome, is very short. And after you've completed it once, there isn't much else to do that re-doing it on a harder difficulty. There are some people out there who have made a couple of custom maps long ago, but the community in general died out. The lack of Workshop doesn't help either. All we can hope for now is that Valve revives the game with new campaigns or makes a sequel.In short: One of the best Co-op games out there and it's free. Definatly worth gathering some friends and giving it a try.

content:
Posted: April 16, 2015
												I used to hate this game. Then it grew on me. It's super simplistic and quick. Shooty shooty bang bang~ Aliens are dead. You win. Repeat until all rounds are done. At least that's how it is abridged and if you are good enough to clear each mission. But it's easy to pick up and learn so you can get good enough fairly quickly. The nice (or worst depending on the kind've player you are) thing about this game is that you don't necessarily need teamwork to beat the mission. You can hang behind, go ahead, make your character spin in circles and you and your team can still make it out fine. Now I don't know what happens if you all decide to spin in circles but at that point, y'all shouldn't be playing this and instead should go ride a merry-go-round. So should you play this FPS? Yeah. Sure. Why not?

content:
Posted: June 1, 2015
												This game is fairly amazing for a free game! When I first started playing it I almost gave it a 'Not Recommended' due to the fact it was near impossible to find anyone willing to play. I tried and tried and decided to give it one final shot which finally rewarded me with a playable game! When we finally got in game I had a great time though blasting my way through aliens and trying to keep my teammates alive.Keep in mind it seems that Valve has abandoned this game. Understandable seeing as they weren't really making any kind of money out of it though. You're not going to find any DLC unless you search for community mods even though the story seems to have alot more to it. It's also very hard to find any other players that actually care about the achievements, if you're into that. The game is good for a few play-throughs but it's fairly unplayable if you're trying to go beyond normal mode or trying for any group achievements.Still, the game is free, so you can't really go wrong! 3/5

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 23, 2014
												It may look easy, but this game is quite difficult, which is where the fun lies. This is how it works. A four man team made of different people who have their own skills (such as a medic who can deploy a med-kit or flares). They then go in on an objective based mission, in which there are aliens to kill and whatnot. Gadgets are spread around the place, such as welders, and sentries. Things can to hell in a handbasket quick. Aliens come from everywhere, and boy are they quick. Ammo isn't easy to find. Once a teammate is dead, they are gone. Friendly fire is a pain in the butt, so watch where you aim. There are events in which you must surive an unending horde for a time. It's basically a top-down Left 4 Dead, but it's different. As a bonus, one achivement earn you a hat in Team Fortress 2! Yay! HAT. YOU KNOW YOU WANT IT.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: April 16, 2015
												I used to hate this game. Then it grew on me. It's super simplistic and quick. Shooty shooty bang bang~ Aliens are dead. You win. Repeat until all rounds are done. At least that's how it is abridged and if you are good enough to clear each mission. But it's easy to pick up and learn so you can get good enough fairly quickly. The nice (or worst depending on the kind've player you are) thing about this game is that you don't necessarily need teamwork to beat the mission. You can hang behind, go ahead, make your character spin in circles and you and your team can still make it out fine. Now I don't know what happens if you all decide to spin in circles but at that point, y'all shouldn't be playing this and instead should go ride a merry-go-round. So should you play this FPS? Yeah. Sure. Why not?

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 13, 2014
												Everyone who has ever played starcraft will understand what I mean when I say "Zerg rush." That's what you're fighting through: A constant, sudden stream of aliens intent on killing the woefully outnumbered (and squishy) Space Marines. Several classes to play with from the start, and an impressive armory to unlock as you level up, means you can play however you see fit. At the impressive cost of nil, and with the exuberant community putting out new material, I have no issues reccommending this game to everyone who'll listen.The only down-side to this game is the random players thrown in. A surprising number of them tend towards the aggressive side of things, and there's a lot of Last-Man-On-Earth posturing. Open-mic is useful, though. Allows everyone to communicate as they need to in order to complete the objectives of each stage. By all means: go for it!

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 20, 2014
												Easily the best 4 player Co-op shooters I've ever played (and one of the few out there really).It features great map designs, enemies, weapons and makes you rely on teamwork like never before.On top of that, it's free.I've had a blast playing this game with 3 other friends and I wish there were more games like this.However the main campaign, despite being awesome, is very short. And after you've completed it once, there isn't much else to do that re-doing it on a harder difficulty. There are some people out there who have made a couple of custom maps long ago, but the community in general died out. The lack of Workshop doesn't help either. All we can hope for now is that Valve revives the game with new campaigns or makes a sequel.In short: One of the best Co-op games out there and it's free. Definatly worth gathering some friends and giving it a try.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 24, 2015
												An interesting co-op top down shooter, in the style of Smash-TV, heavily influenced by Aliens and Starship Troopers, with shades of Left 4 Dead. The recently released PS-Exclusive Helldivers looks like a direct clone of this game.As of this writing, the community is quite thin.  One 7-mission campaign is available for free, with lots of community levels floating around, but no official content was ever released. Co-op multi-player games like this live and die by map rotations, and years of no official maps have very much killed the player base.A stock levelling system controls weapon availability, and many interesting weapons make repeated missions interesting. An early update enabled repeating the 27 levels with higher EXP requirements, but this just makes the grind to unlock weapons more grindy.  A free and very fun game, not without it's blemishes, but definitely worth the time and attention but try to bring 3 friends along, as finding random to play with is a lost cause.

												As far as free games go, this is a really good one to kill some time with a few friends while you're waiting on someone/something. I recommend playing with a friend or two as teamwork is a vital part of this fun little game.  B-

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 11, 2011
												Alien Swarm for unreal tournament 2004 was quite a unique type of game back in those times. Valve most certainly did not make a mistake by hiring the same team who made the previously mentioned mod to create a very impressive remake using the Source Engine. Despite the short campaign and a vaguely explained storyline, the game offers loads of fun in cooperative missions which can range from 2 to even 8 players in certain servers. It's also free, so there are always lots of servers to play on. The replay value is infinite, as your skills improve, so do your standards, and this game offers quite a few challenging settings.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 16, 2013
												A Valve-made "free" co-op TPS in which up to 4 players play against a horde of aliens. A hat for "Team Fortress 2" wearable by all classes can be obtained by completing 2 co-op missions online. It's very fun to play with team though you'll have great trouble finding mates unless you have some friends to play...co-op mode is almost dead! :( Remember not to reload until you run out of ammo in the clip or remaining ammo in that clip will be lost. Despite its potential, there's just 1 campaign, no support for Steam Workshop...this is the most underappreciated of all Valve's game.(Japanese translation below)==================================================エイリアンの大群相手に戦う、最大4人まで参加可能なValve製の無料で遊べる協力プレイ型TPS。co-opモードで2ステージを攻略するとTeam Fortress 2で全クラスが使える帽子が貰えます。かなりの過疎状態でフレンドを呼ばない限りチームを組むのは困難ですが、チームさえ組めれば大いに楽しめます。リロードの度に弾倉内の残弾が消滅する仕様なので撃ち尽くすまでリロードは控えましょう。ゲームとして発展できる余地があるにも関わらずキャンペーンは1つ、ワークショップにも非対応というValve作品の中で最も不遇な扱いを受けている作品です。

content:
Posted: February 18, 2015
												First off: This is an excellent top-down, coop shooter.Get a few friends together (there is a matchmaking kind of thing going on, but in europe it's populated mostly by russians) and play through the missions that are there.After that you could ramp up the difficulty, but other than that there's not much more to it sadly.The game was released "as is" and then abandoned. It won't get any more love from Valve.As I said at the top, it IS a great game, and if you haven't played it yet and you are into coop shooters, you should at least play through what is available.

content:
Posted: March 9, 2015
												In all honesty, I downloaded this for a free hat.It turned out to be much better than I thought it would. The levels are thought out very well, and flow nicely, but they do it while keeping you on edge, and the difficulty high.This is really fun if you have at least 2 players. The only thing I really dislike is the team killing, there's no way to disable it. Even though it could be funny to kill your team mates once in a while, sometimes it gets annoying when we finally decide to play the game properly.I would highly recommend this game though, runs great, and it's more addicting than it seems it would be. It doesn't have tons of content, which is probably why this is free, but if they added a few more missions this could easily be worth some money.

												This game was a heartbreak to play.Not cause it was a bad game per say, nor was it an unenjoyable game to play but simply due to the fact it was too short to play.3 hours of consistant screaming and telling each other what to do was most probably the most fun i've had in the past few years of my still very short life, with this being said, I can only hope and pray that valve will return to this gem of a game and rework it into an even better one (if possible).On the whole, with a mixture of spending 10 minutes figuring out what classes we were gonna play and the weapons we were going to use, this game is the true definition of f2p fun.I do reccomend it to anyone looking for a 2-4 man co-op game that involves shooting/teamkilling.

												QUICK AND SHORT REVIEWAlien Swarm is a game abandoned by Valve, just because it didn't make profit.The gameplay is good, even though it gets boring pretty quick (2-3 hours).Not surprising, for a 2 GB game, that had almost no updates to it.Do I recommend this game ?YES, but even then, you need to have the bots, because the community for this game is dead.How may you spawn them ?Here's the command: "cl_selectm <0-7> -1" where 0-7 is the marine you want, and -1 is "next slot".

content:
Posted: July 25, 2014
												It is very sad this game simply did not get the post-release support it deserved. The game is effectively a top-down L4D style co-op shooter, but with aliens. In fact it runs on the Source engine and was made by Valve developers who worked on L4D. The gameplay is fantastic and even has an unlock system with loads of weapons and gear to unlock, as well as player classes like the heavy and medic. The base game has only one campaign and not a true solo experience (You can only play 1 level of the campaign in singleplayer). But, there is a map-pack on the forum of this game that add's loads of community campaigns from the games now dead mod site, as well as being able to play all levels in singleplayer.This game is totally free, not any of that F2P crap and is very fun, with a good load of maps to get, so really, there is no reason to not have this game.

content:
Posted: February 10, 2014
												Coop alien killing game "COOL RIGHT?!?!?!"In short "meh"The game is a coop over head view shooter in which u and and other marines are tasked with shooting your way threw aliens to get to and complete your objectives.Thats the idea.You get a coop over head view shooter where one guy is the "VIP MISSION CRITICAL ENGIE, PROTECT HIM OR YOU LOSE" macguffin (he has to hack abot 3 or so consoles excusive to only him that block your progress) and a good example that friendly fire isnt (you will find yourself killing your allys in the crossfire almost as much as the aliens.Though if u bring competent friends u can avoid constant ff incidents and protect each other effectlly (but mostly the fragile engie) u will have a good time.In short: Bring friends, have fun. :D

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 28, 2014
												A must play for any moba, shooting, action games or even any open minded person.Replayability is insane, since you acquire new weapons as you get rank but must reset your acquisitions to increase in ranks and change badges.Difficulty settings actually matter and definetly makes things waaaay more interesting. It changes the game from a casual park stroll to must. dodge. sulfuric-acid-rain-drops.extremely addicting. Simple mechanics, making it a simple to learn yet hard and fun to master. The only downside is the continually low amount of players to play with and the lack of content.I would definetly pay to see this game get more content and keep going... So on a positive side, yea sure its free... but once you play and love it you realize that being free is a negative point.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 20, 2013
												When they lauchned this title, it was pretty damn popular for a while. Right now, as far as i can tell, the multiplayer is pretty much dead but if you can bring friends with you you'll definitely have a blast. The game is basically a 4-players coop overhead shooter where you have to complete several linear missions that you can replay whenever you want. There are multiple difficulty level and i can tell you that the highest difficulties really are awfully hard so no matter how good you are at the game you can still make it challenging. There are 4 different classes, each of them feature 2 playable characters (for a total of 8 characters) that have different stats as well as some unique perks and items based on their class. There is a progression system where by you get experience for every mission you play and unlock stuff as you level up. Getting to the maximum level really isn't much of a challenge but the game features a prestige system (as far as i can remember, prestiging doesn't give you any advantage whatsoever but i might be wrong). The game does have its flaws, for example I would say that the level design is fairly weak as the missions are extremely linear and you're usually not rewarded at all for exploring. Also, the game is obviously not meant to be played by a team of less than 4 people, you will have a hard time if your team is not full. That is about it in terms of bad stuff i have to say about the game, which is very surprising considering this is a free-to-play game with no microtransaction at all, meaning it does not make any money whatsoever. The developpers also did a very good job with the combat, it feels very very good and the game handles every aspect of it very well. While I'm at it, I must praise the fact that fighting aliens that are below or above you is done very, very easily, which is something that most 3D overhead shooters don't do well at all.Overall a very solid game that you don't have to spend a penny on, in fact you CAN'T spend money on it. You definitely won't find an awful lot of people online but play it with friend. You'll all have an awesome moment. No really, I'm serious, download it and enjoy it. NOW.

content:
Posted: September 16, 2014
												Divertido, adictivo y genial. Estos 3 adjetivos son los que encuentro más adecuados para describir este juego sin mesionar tambien que es Gratis. En lo general se destaca un modo de juego muy llamativo y divertido, la jugabilidad es un punto  muy fuerte en este juego y en lo que respecta a sonido y soundtracks no hay mucho que decir la verdad, a mi criterio  me parece que es normal.En lo que en realidad se destaca este juego es en la facilidad para divertir "Si se tiene 3 compañeros con los cuales jugar". Una vez tengas un grupo armado y listo para jugar el resto es historia. Las misiones, personajes, roles estan muy bien pensadas. En el juego hay luegar para toda clase de estrategias, desde la "Rambo" asi le llamo yo a avanzar como loco  matando todo a su paso hasta la más estrategica.En resumen si eres un jugador que le gusta lo diferente, divertido y porque no gratis este es el juego definitivamente.Le doy un 4.0/5.0

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 20, 2013
												When they lauchned this title, it was pretty damn popular for a while. Right now, as far as i can tell, the multiplayer is pretty much dead but if you can bring friends with you you'll definitely have a blast. The game is basically a 4-players coop overhead shooter where you have to complete several linear missions that you can replay whenever you want. There are multiple difficulty level and i can tell you that the highest difficulties really are awfully hard so no matter how good you are at the game you can still make it challenging. There are 4 different classes, each of them feature 2 playable characters (for a total of 8 characters) that have different stats as well as some unique perks and items based on their class. There is a progression system where by you get experience for every mission you play and unlock stuff as you level up. Getting to the maximum level really isn't much of a challenge but the game features a prestige system (as far as i can remember, prestiging doesn't give you any advantage whatsoever but i might be wrong). The game does have its flaws, for example I would say that the level design is fairly weak as the missions are extremely linear and you're usually not rewarded at all for exploring. Also, the game is obviously not meant to be played by a team of less than 4 people, you will have a hard time if your team is not full. That is about it in terms of bad stuff i have to say about the game, which is very surprising considering this is a free-to-play game with no microtransaction at all, meaning it does not make any money whatsoever. The developpers also did a very good job with the combat, it feels very very good and the game handles every aspect of it very well. While I'm at it, I must praise the fact that fighting aliens that are below or above you is done very, very easily, which is something that most 3D overhead shooters don't do well at all.Overall a very solid game that you don't have to spend a penny on, in fact you CAN'T spend money on it. You definitely won't find an awful lot of people online but play it with friend. You'll all have an awesome moment. No really, I'm serious, download it and enjoy it. NOW.

												Coop alien killing game "COOL RIGHT?!?!?!"In short "meh"The game is a coop over head view shooter in which u and and other marines are tasked with shooting your way threw aliens to get to and complete your objectives.Thats the idea.You get a coop over head view shooter where one guy is the "VIP MISSION CRITICAL ENGIE, PROTECT HIM OR YOU LOSE" macguffin (he has to hack abot 3 or so consoles excusive to only him that block your progress) and a good example that friendly fire isnt (you will find yourself killing your allys in the crossfire almost as much as the aliens.Though if u bring competent friends u can avoid constant ff incidents and protect each other effectlly (but mostly the fragile engie) u will have a good time.In short: Bring friends, have fun. :D
